intro: Alcea scabridula, commonly known as the rough hollyhock, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine, bristly hairs, giving it its common name. It typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common sight in gardens and along roadsides. Alcea scabridula is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
